reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visit Brighton regularly but usually stay with friends. However, this time we needed a place to stay and wanted to be back in Hove, which is where we used to live. Hove is much less hectic than Brighton (and not so tacky) and it's only a 20 minute walk into the city centre (along the sea front - sets you up for the day!). Alternatively there is a regular bus service.
reviews.title: Lovely but Brighton accommodation is too expensive!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So - the Claremont... this is a B&B of a high standard. Our room and the communal areas were spotlessly clean and tastefully and comfortably decorated. Breakfasts were excellent and cheerfully served.
reviews.title: Comfort and Style!

reviews.text: On the more negative side, it's not the greatest welcome to be asked to sign a declaration stating that you won't eat in your room as soon as you arrive and it would be nice to have individual toiletries rather than the chained down refillable bottles (yes, Gilchrist & Soames, lovely products, but still feels a bit like a Travelodge). Reading the customer information it seemed you could ask for help with most things and it would be given, but it would be better if some of this was anticipated - eg fresh milk would be nice without having to make a special request - I can't imagine many people prefer the cartons of UHT. Given the price of the rooms I also think they could include the price of a parking voucher (£3 for 24 hours). These are minor quibbles but it's the little touches and attention to detail that make a place really stand out.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and very friendly hotel in Hove

likes.disliked: — No sitting room or bar but the Hove Place in the next street is fairly quiet with a nice garden
